p: The surviving flies after treatment with LC 50 doses of EO, methyl chavicol and linalool (9,98, 13.62 and 43.13 μg/adult, respectively) were used for the extraction of whole-body homogenate. Acetone-treated adults were used as control. The flies were homogenised in ice cold 50-mM phosphate buffer (pH 7.4). Homogenates were centrifuged at 4 oC for 20 min at 10,000 rpm. The supernatant was subjected to protein estimation using Bradford’s method (Bradford 1976) and used as an enzyme source for the estimation of carboxylesterase (CarE) and glutathione S-transferase (GST) activities.
